titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: I turned out the Anson papers, and meditated making a start. The whole business looks more hopeless than ever. Canon Talbot Rice arrived about lunch–time. Wynne–Willson came & helped me with letters. Sir Robert Leighton came to dinner, & then we all went to the Town Hall for the Missionary Meeting, which was præternaturally dull. Both the speakers – the Bishop of Sierra Leone, & Canon Talbot Rice – had nothing to say about "mass – movements in India" which was the subject announced for the meeting. The Archdeacon of Hereford & Talbot Rice stayed the night. Before going to bed, we had some talk in my study. M
Dillon, who had come to spend the Sunday in Hereford, prolonged her visit in order to attend the Missionary Meeting, & was perhaps hardly rewarded for her pains.
